title: Temporal Rift
contents: The year is 2050. The New Earth Alliance safeguards global stability and maintains a fragile peace after the Era of Wars. But not everyone accepts this peace. The techno-driven organization Citadel of Return consists of modern techno-radicals who believe they alone have the right to decide the planet's fate.Citadel of Return's sabotage of the SABER-777 AI's trials sent several Alliance ships based on old designs, but armed with modern weaponry back in time. There, they are awaited by a modified flotilla of the Citadel, which had been hiding in secret World War II bases.¬†Now these two forces stand face to face‚Äîand battle is inevitable.Inside: Technology from the future. Outside: A look grounded in the past. This will be a brutal fight‚Ä¶Update¬†14.10 welcomes Temporal Rift:¬†a new PvE event battle type with explosive attack-and-defense gameplay and missile weaponry.Temporal Rift consists of two Operations‚ÄîShattered Time and Rift Watch. They will be available sequentially during Update¬†14.10 for 2¬†weeks each. After that, both Operations will rotate randomly during the first 2¬†weeks of Update¬†14.11, giving you plenty of time to enjoy new battle type and collect all the rewards.Read on to see what exactly the time warp has brought to the game!ASIA29 October 2025, 19:00 UTC10 December 2025, 19:00 UTCEU30 October 2025, 02:00 UTC11 December 2025, 02:00 UTCNA29 October 2025, 09:00 UTC10 December 2025, 09:00 UTCBriefing Time: Event RulesShattered Time and Rift Watch have shared core mechanics, but your task in the first¬†Operation is to press the offensive, while in the second‚Äîyou're tasked with standing firm in defense.Join a nine-player team to battle against waves of bots on a very large, Arctic-inspired map. It's divided into three defense lines, with three sectors in each containing varying numbers of Key Areas. The first two lines of defense lie ahead of the attacking team before breaching the enemy base in a climactic final battle at the heart of the anomaly.A few additional rules govern this chrono-distorted battlespace:The next defensive line unlocks when you capture enough Key Areas in the previous one.Capturing each Key Area will destabilize an aspect of the enemy base defenses, reducing the effectiveness of artillery forts, repair ships, and aircraft carriers at the base.You will move to the next defensive line when the timer runs out regardless of whether you fail to capture enough Key Areas.While capturing defense lines is the primary task, failing this won't end the battle. Defeat only occurs if you fail to capture the enemy base in time.However, you should strive to win at each line. Even if you lose the first one, for example, capturing the second will still weaken the enemy base.Moreover, capturing Key Areas as soon as possible both softens the base defenses and buys more precious time for your final showdown.Hint: Check behind the isles for those pesky aircraft carriers and repair ships. You want to destroy them first, so look out for an unusual concentration of planes in the air or a red healing circle on the water.The enemy base has two small Key Areas; capturing one is enough to win the battle.When your ship is destroyed, the Rift will not expel you entirely. Similar to the Unbreakable Line event, you will rejoin the fight, though there are some changes to the mechanic:You return with temporary buffs to speed, concealment, acceleration, and maneuverability.Additionally, all of your consumables and missiles are replenished. Your torpedo launchers will be instantly ready even if they were in the process of reloading before you were sunk.You can choose the exact respawn sector to return to and rejoin the fight.As you push forward to a new defensive line, the respawn sectors shift forward as well, ensuring you can keep up with the advancing frontline.Note that in Rift Watch, where your team will be tasked with defending the base and the Key Areas from bot attackers, you'll get to take advantage of the base's defense bonuses (artillery forts, repair ships, and aircraft carriers) as well. Beware though: Those advantages can be eroded if enemy bots manage to capture Key Areas.Incoming: Missile FeatureMissiles are a new offensive feature that can inflict heavy damage and are available only in Temporal Rift‚Äîboth for players and some bots (you will spot them by the "M" prefix in their ship‚Äôs name). Player ships are equipped with countermeasures to help defend against this threat. Missiles add an entirely new layer of gameplay and tactical approaches to Temporal Rift, and this is how they work:MissilesEach ship has a limited number of missiles. They replenish upon ship respawns, but there are some other ways to resupply as well.To launch a missile, select it ("4" by default), choose the desired area within range, and fire. That's it!There's no need to guide the missile manually, it will do its lethal job itself.Upon approaching the center of the selected area, the missile will scan for enemy targets there:If a...

Battle Performance Bonuses return, giving you the chance to earn Festive Tokens or Steel (for superships). Festive Tokens can be exchanged for new Japanese Tier X cruiser Kushiro, bonus packages for Tier X ships, Supercontainers, the "This Is Fine" enemy destruction effect, and containers from historic collections that unlock unique Commanders. Surface ships only: No submarines or carriers. 12v12 Domination and Standard battles with year-based restrictions on maps and ships. Heavy armor and improved Hydroacoustic Search, but low agility. Permanent camouflages available for Knesebeck, Manteuffel, and Prinz Adalbert. Sequential bundles unlock in the second week of Update 14.8. Asymmetric Battles Return {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/31013613/42604f81a2f933f320424f85eab562f2d1efd862.jpg Back and here for longer than ever! Available from mid-September through Update 15.2 (five months). Classic format: 5 human players vs. 12 AI-controlled ships, two tiers lower. Playable on Tier VI‚ÄìX ships and superships. Expanded map pool that includes over 25 maps. Participate in Arctic Convoy, Tokyo Express, and Pacific Offensive Operations (Tier VII‚ÄìIX ships). Earn Stars through tasks to progress the campaign of U.S. Navy officer Robert Adams. Clan Battles Season 31 "Mahi-Mahi" begins, plus Ranked Battles and three new Brawls across September and October. title: Update 14.6 | American Destroyers, Event Pass, and Major Improvements!
contents: {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/31013613/366c1cd1c943d93a9452436287ed2b3bed9dfd64.jpg Here‚Äôs an overview of the major highlights introduced in Update 14.6. Be sure to check out the full details on our website: EU NA ASIA Early Access: American Destroyers {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/31013613/f202711b794b4cc244a205a4168eb0b51e1a1590.png Welcome a new line of American destroyers with a focus on main battery firepower! Tier VII Hughes, Tier VIII Osborne, Tier IX Christopher, and Tier X Burrows feature HE and SAP shells. Starting from Tier VIII, they carry high-DPM 137 mm guns and have larger HP pools. Minimal torpedo armament, low concealment capacity. These ships favor mid- to long-range engagements. Unique toggleable Smoke Generator mechanic adds tactical flexibility. Available via sequential bundles for American Tokens and Doubloons during Early Access. Event Pass: American & French Flair {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/31013613/47da375a601b833620f80bf78f7e75695003a1ed.jpg Collect new content through this classic two-line Event Pass! First progression line: 400 American Tokens, 3 days of Premium Account, 2x French Squadron containers, and the "Go Navy!" permanent camouflage for Cleveland. Second progression line (2,500 Doubloons): West Virginia permanent camouflage (immediate), West Virginia '41 herself, 4x French Squadron containers, 1x Journey to the West Premium container, and the French Navy permanent camouflage for Le Fantasque.. Extra levels reward 1x More Signals container (first line) or 1x Rare Bonuses container (second line). Personal Challenges Return {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/31013613/7a148214a2c0115cc26efee9e408f1bedc27dcea.jpg Back as part of Early Access for destroyers! Runs until Update 14.7, in two sprints of two weeks each. Earn American Tokens through Base XP milestones. Massive Graphics & Interface Updates {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/31013613/2b59be0c5ae79ef70925fe3a679606e12ccd8860.jpg Enjoy a smoother, cleaner look! WG Temporal Super Sampling (TSS) enhances anti-aliasing and image stability. Container barge now features: Faster access to container lists from the main screen. Reward previews with drop chances. Guaranteed reward counter. New options for mass opening with safety confirmations. Barge animations can now be disabled. Content Rarity System {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/31013613/75ca9533865fe7076b2a107f08cebd22874b3ac6.jpg Understand exclusivity at a glance! Ships, camouflages, and effects now show rarity grades: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Epic, Legendary. Pricing across the game aligns with these categories. Clarifies effort vs. accessibility, but does not indicate power level. Ship Rotation System Streamlining the Armory and Premium Shop. Popular ships stay available; others rotate on a scheduled basis. First rotation: Brisbane, Almirante Grau, Nottingham, and Numancia (for Doubloons); Nottingham also for Coal. San Diego and Leone removed, but San Diego returns in Update 14.7‚Äôs event collection; Leone remains in the Italian Destroyers collection. Final Update: Experimental Ships & Classified Documents {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/31013613/8961a02e85d40d36971b3188e86d7eb22e315332.jpg Closing chapters on temporary mechanics. Operations with Flagships and experimental ships end with Update 14.6. Classified Documents now upgradeable to Level 11. Complete experimental ship research now for final rewards in Update 14.7. Leaderboards are live, so check your standings! Blue Archive Collaboration: Chapter Two {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/31013613/19ac4a07d4dd0ca0b921891ccb91fe9db82d75b7.jpg Class is back in session on the high seas! Four new Blue Archive ships and exclusive camouflages. Four new themed commanders with individual voiceovers. Sail in style with Kivotos-themed flair and charm! Grand Trial ‚Äì Public Test Challenge {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/31013613/ead6990ac32e7576b6fd3d4330265e6ee3772bfa.jpg The summer phase continues! Earn rewards by completing tasks across test phases of Updates 14.6‚Äì14.8. Main reward for Update 14.6: 1x Soviet Era container and 1x Soviet Era Premium container. Complete all seasonal phases for the ultimate annual prize. This is just the beginning, so dive into Update 14.6 and explore it all. title: Work in Progress: Update¬†14.6 Round 2
contents: {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/31013613/ead6990ac32e7576b6fd3d4330265e6ee3772bfa.jpg This is a short overview of the planned features for Update¬†14.6. For more information, visit the relevant link: EU NA ASIA IMPORTANT! Because the update is still being tested, the information in this article is tentative and reflects the state of game development at the time of its publication. Some changes and new features may be removed entirely or implemented differently by the time the update goes live. Hey, Captains! With Update¬†14.5 in full swing, it's now time to cast our eyes forward and take a sneak peek at the fun new features Update¬†14.6 will be delivering in just a few short weeks! Here's a quick breakdown of some of the most notable new additions: New U.S. destroyers: Ships of the new branch are great gunslingers and have a unique new feature‚Äîa Smoke Generator that can be toggled on or off! {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/31013613/e9b9b328109a58063fa135d66a665e0120260605.jpg {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/31013613/f90f4a467e11d3802be6f996f34699552cea2acd.jpg {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/31013613/94bee02adb33ad945ee8102099fd32710af9f862.jpg {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/31013613/b6633fe4402792831778b19f72f597c910fb5b8c.jpg Graphical improvements: Enabling the WG Temporal Super Sampling setting in your game client will deliver sharper visuals and smoother edges without significantly impacting performance. Rarity system: It'll soon be a lot more intuitive to understand just how unique in-game content is thanks to a new system of visual rarity for ships, camos, and beyond. This improvement goes hand-in-hand with a standardized pricing model for direct sales based on this system. Container Barge improvements: This package of changes aims to improve your experience on the container-opening screen, with the introduction of an animation skip, better container content breakdowns, more flexible options for bulk opening, and an integrated guaranteed drop counter! If you want the full and detailed breakdown, check out a dedicated article on our website! Click through to it right here: EU NA ASIA

Inspired by the Convoy battle type from past updates, Perilous Route sees you and your team escort a damaged command ship across the map as it slowly repairs itself. Along the way, the command ship will make two stops, where your team will receive randomized objectives to complete before continuing the journey. Advance through the event by completing key missions and fulfilling the operation's objectives. Each mission can be thought of as a puzzle that you need to solve using the available cards. Each card represents a ship under your command, while enemy cards represent different obstacles like aircraft or coastal artillery. The activity offers rewards like Credits, Operation Dynamo containers, and British Premium destroyer Gallant (the final reward). And More! The ship's construction consists of 20 Dockyard phases; 18 of these will be completable through in-game combat missions. Individual phases can be purchased for Doubloons, and as usual, there are two starter pack options to get a head start. At Phase 8, you'll pick up Commonwealth cruiser Gambia as an intermediate reward. Unlike her sister ship Fiji, Gambia has access to HE shells and Short-Burst Smoke Generator, making her a brutal combatant against enemy battleships. {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/31013613/cb1d22eb0ce8ed1366652c95fa23eb9f27de63b1.jpg Efficiency Badges {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/31013613/17128fcc2a59fd3af73a25f6bbad11bf40b45acd.jpg With Update 14.3, you'll be able to earn Efficiency Badges as a mark of personal pride for your performance aboard individual ships. After each Random Battle you finish, the Base XP you earned is tracked and compared against the recent average performance of other players globally aboard the same ship that you just played. Depending on how well you performed in comparison to your fellow players, you can receive an Efficiency Badge with one of four ranks. You can view the Efficiency Badges for each of your ships in your profile summary, as well as on the post-battle statistics screen for the ship you sailed into battle. Only the highest-ranked badge for each of your ships will be displayed, meaning that if you upgrade a badge, it will replace the old one. For more information about these and more features, check out our dedicated article: EU NA ASIA

contents: Read the Update 14.2 Changelog {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/31013613/f34a81976c74400ce5eb30170e033872972a0fa2.jpg This week saw the launch of a game update so packed with content that you'll be spoiled for choice on how to spend your time on the waves this weekend and the coming ones! From new experimental ships to a new branch of Soviet submarines in Early Access, plus the return of Operations with Flagships and a pirate-themed Bounty Hunt, Update 14.2 truly has something for everyone. Get a comprehensive breakdown of all the new features and changes in our dedicated article: EU Experiment With New Experimental Ships {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/31013613/1a2f0a022212304637214881c09af2ca639a04ab.jpg From now until August 2025, you'll have free rein to play around with some quirky new ships subject to quirky new mechanics. For now, in Update 14.2, you can unlock and play cruisers Metz, Oregon, and Vyazma. These three ships have access to what we're calling "Fight or Flight"‚Äîa mechanic where your ship becomes stronger the more damage it takes. The trio also has access to a limited stockpile of AP shells with improved characteristics that can be fired using Burst Fire mode. You can unlock experimental ships by researching their components in exchange for a combination of Credits and Action Reports, the latter of which are obtainable via special combat missions. For more information about experimental ships, see our dedicated article: EU Dive Back Into Operations with Flagships {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/31013613/a4802c0204dd8b84e967d1d08433363cbd8805a8.jpg Back by popular demand, Operations with Flagships have received a few tweaks in Update 14.2 to make them that much more engaging. Now, three enemy bot flagships of two different types with different effects and vulnerabilities await you on the battlefield. The flagships will be randomly selected, and you'll see which ones you'll be up against at the start of the battle. You can now also equip one Classified Document per battle to customize your ship's capabilities against certain ship types, working both against ordinary bots and the flagships themselves. This special mechanic will make your ship more effective in encounters with specific enemies. All details about the tweaks to this battle type can be found via this link: EU Discover a New Branch of Soviet Submarines in Early Access {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/31013613/25fc410079f68b8f608ffdc298b5b128c1e7fb88.jpg Three new submarines‚ÄîS-1, L-20, and K-1‚Äîmake up the latest branch of the Soviet Tech Tree, which is now available to play in Early Access. These subs make use of capable unguided torpedoes to deal the bulk of their damage. They enjoy good surface speed but lack the agility and dive capacity for frequent underwater escapades. The trio can be of great help to their allies, as they have access to the Submarine Surveillance consumable with a long range. All three submarines are available in sequential bundles in the Armory, purchasable for Soviet Tokens. You can obtain the Tokens by completing combat missions or purchasing random bundles. title: Come Back and Continue Your Journey, Now on Steam!
contents: Captains, We want to share extra special news today! It's now easier than ever to access World of Warships and continue your progression through the platform of your choice. With the release of Update 14.2, we're introducing a long-awaited feature: you can link your existing account to Steam and freely play using the platform, even if your account wasn't created through Steam! When the integration with Steam was first implemented, such a thing wasn't possible; however, over the past few years, we've been working on updating the system to bring these changes to all Wargaming titles, and recent updates were a crucial part of the necessary preparations. Thanks to extensive improvements to our account infrastructure, you can now seamlessly switch between Steam and the Wargaming Game Center (WGC) while keeping your in-game progress. More details are available here.

title: Update 14.2 | New Mechanics, Experimental Ships, and Soviet Submarines!
contents: Here‚Äôs an overview of the major highlights introduced in Update 14.2. Be sure to check out the detailed article on our website: EU NA ASIA Experimental Ships {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/31013613/8637aac21c2f5c2aae641bf464491730bf4e72ff.jpg Three new ships with unique mechanics are sailing out on our seas! Designed for bold Captains, these vessels bring high-risk, high-reward gameplay: These experimental ships start each battle with reduced HP but can heal over time. Where it gets very interesting is that their main battery accuracy and rate of fire improve as their HP decreases. Will you choose the security of HP or the risky but satisfying firepower route? Armed with a limited stock of AP shells with improved characteristics and Burst Fire mode. They have no module upgrades, their economic earnings are similar to same-tier Tech Tree ships, and Commanders assigned to experimental ships do not require retraining. You can unlock experimental ships by researching components with Credits and Action Reports from combat missions, and get a special mission chain that offers Coal as a reward. These ships will be removed with Update 14.7, and commemorative rewards will be bestowed on players who successfully unlock all three. Operations with Flagships & Classified Documents {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/31013613/6bc02d11d8bf491aa338e2fab05395d2aa63cb43.jpg Operations with Flagships return with reworked mechanics, introducing varied flagship encounters and greater strategic diversity. New mechanics have been integrated to enhance combat effectiveness in specific scenarios: Equip one Classified Document in Operations with Flagships for survivability and damage boosts. All Classified Documents have been added to player accounts automatically and can be selected before each battle, with a limited time for changes. Soviet Submarines & Event Pass {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/31013613/2b0ef47b6e230dc0aa8e4c254517644a898d624b.jpg Comrades, the Red Fleet is growing mightier! The arrival of submarines S-1, L-20, and K-1 introduces a new Soviet playstyle: Powerful, fast, and long-range unguided torpedoes, plus homing torpedoes with low damage, speed, and range. Fast surface speed but limited dive capacity. They are also equipped with long-range Submarine Surveillance and Fast Damage Control Team. Celebrate the Soviet expansion with the Soviet Navy Event Pass! {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/31013613/fb627d56136b4cc04a6a5b895eee0f9d9b645e8c.jpg The first progression line features 5x Soviet Era containers, Commander Aleksey Statsenko, and a Soviet permanent camouflage for Tallinn. Unlock the second progression line for 2,500 Doubloons to earn additional rewards, including Soviet permanent camouflages for Riga and Petropavlovsk, 10x Soviet Era containers, and cruiser Molotov. Captains who already own these items will be compensated in Credits. Pirate-Themed Bounty Hunt {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/31013613/1a1b1212c2b0875b556472dfdd67d1120d1ad291.jpg Hoist the black flag and engage in thrilling Random Battles: Play as a Hunter (Tier V‚ÄìX ships) or Bounty (Tier VI‚ÄìX battleships, cruisers, and destroyers) to earn Bounty Tokens for themed Commanders and permanent camouflages. The Bounty status is available for free in the Armory and lasts 24 hours or until the main mission (sink 5 enemy ships) is completed. Random bundles hold new ship Monmouth, with direct purchase options available until the release of Update 14.3. That's just a glimpse of what's new in this fresh update!
